name: Vincent Ng
biography: Vincent Ng is a Professor in the Computer Science department at the University of Texas at Dallas (UTD). He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stanford University. His research primarily focuses on natural language processing, machine learning, and human language technology. He has received several accolades for his work, including best paper awards and grant funding for various research initiatives.
notable_publications: Ng, V., & Cardie, C. (2002). Improving machine learning approaches to coreference resolution. The Proceedings of the 40th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.
Ng, V., & Lee, J. (1997). Integrating multiple knowledge sources for coreference resolution. Proceedings of the 35th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.
Ng, V., & Seneff, S. (2006). The role of language in multimedia presentations: A challenge to communication design education. Journal of Visual Literacy.
research_focus: Natural Language Processing, Coreference Resolution, Machine Learning, Human Language Technology
